citation.article-title: Streptococcus waius sp. nov., a thermophilic Streptococcus from a biofilm.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus waius sp. nov.
Streptococcus waius (waius. New Zealand Maori n. waiu milk; N.L. gen. n. waius of milk)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, non-spore forming, 0.7 μm diameter cocci in pairs or short chains.
When the organism is grown on M17 agar at 37°C for 48 h, colonies are 0.5 mm in diameter, circular, convex, translucent and smooth.
The organisms are homofermentative, facultatively anaerobic and catalasenegative.
The organisms will clot milk at 45°C with an optimum temperature for growth of 38.8°C, but are capable of growing over a range of 24.5-52.4°C.
They will grow over the pH range 4.0-10.0 and are tolerant of salt up to 7 % NaCl.
They are intolerant of bile at 1 %.
The bacteria ferment galactose, D-glucose, D-fructose, D-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, saccharose and D-raffinose.

The bacterium produces the following enzymes: leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase.The DNA G + C content is 34.6 mol%.
The habitat is milk and dairy products.
The type strain is 3/1T and is lodged in the New Zealand Reference Culture Collection (NZRCC 20100T) at the New Zealand Dairy Research Institute, Palmerston North, New Zealand.
